newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end 2.73 pct up, seen rising.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end 2.73 pct up, seen rising.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished sharply up on Wednesday amid speculative buying spurred by Tuesday's economic reforms package unveiled by the central bank, and dealers said the index could rise further.
"The market has improved as most of the bad news has already factored in the prices and the economic pacakage was not as bad as expected earlier," dealer Khalid Hussain said.

The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index surged 38.11 points, or 2.73 percent, to end at 1,431.74. Gainers led losers 153 to 67. Turnover rose to 29.69 million shares from 22.79 million on Tuesday.
